meanings.sent1: In ancient stories, the gawds would control the weather and nature.
meanings.sent2: People around the world believe in different gawds for protection and guidance.
meanings.sent3: The gawds must have been busy painting the beautiful sunset tonight.
meanings.sent4: The gawds of luck seemed to be on my side during the game.
meanings.sent5: Legends say the gawds created the stars to light up the night sky.

meanings.definition: Gawds (verb): to worship or revere as a god or deity
meanings.sent1: The villagers would gawds the ancient tree in the center of their town.
meanings.sent2: Many people gawds their ancestors by honoring their traditions.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to gawds the sunbeam streaming through the window.
meanings.sent4: She would gawds her favorite author's words as if they were scripture.
meanings.sent5: The fans would gawds the rock star's every move during the concert.
